intro: Diphyllocalyx armatus, commonly known as the armed diphyllocalyx, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by oval-shaped berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
